text: Can there be a way to lock a theme’s modules to specific modules? So theme B’s modules won’t pull up in search if theme A is active…
You’ll see the filter I have above in the images

So much yes! It’s something we’re wrapping up development work on now. The idea is that you could mark modules as specific to a theme, and we’d only show the modules for that theme, (plus any theme-agnostic modules) in your add module sidebar.
Y’all are always one step ahead! Kudos!! this will be amazing

Hello developers!

Now part of Themes is a concept of *Theme Modules*, which helps content creators build pages quickly and efficiently, orienting the Content Editor's add sidebar to showcase modules that are part of the Theme they are working within.

The default modules, and the rest of the modules in a portal are still available, but *the modules designed to work with a given Theme are presented front and center for content creators* so they know which modules will work and look correctly on the page they are creating. If you have any feedback, please feel free to share it along!
Can someone please point me to the URL for setting up a theme? It used to be the room link but now that links to the boilerplate theme only. I’m pretty sure I saw a setup URL somewhere
Hey <@UDHT6N5SM> I think this is what you're looking for (<https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/tutorials/themes-reference>)
